column1: @BennieGThompson Thank you Bennie!
Thank you! https://t.co/kNmhgjpLvG

To my constituents who have served as well as all veterans across the country and your families thank you for your immeasurable sacrifices and service to our country! We salute you today and every day. #VeteransDay2020
Ask Yourself: https://t.co/FTMsVXGhSH

If passed the Jobs and Justice Act will strengthen America’s workforce by promoting small businesses raising the minimum wage and creating jobs in historically-underserved communities. #JobsAndJustice2020

The people’s House just passed the #CROWNAct. I’m proud to have introduced this legislation and thank my colleagues @RepBarbaraLee @RepMarciaFudge @RepPressley for their contributions to this bill and for wearing their own crowns with pride and dignity. https://t.co/NE89Ws65eH

Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was a giant trailblazer and one of America’s most treasured minds. May she rest in eternal peace. My prayers go to her family friends colleagues and all those who loved and admired her.
@RepWilson Thank you!
Thank you! https://t.co/8vm2cYJmqR

19 years ago today we experienced the unthinkable. May we all take a moment out of our day to honor all  victims lost on 9/11 and continue to send strength to their families. Let us also honor the bravery of our first responders and the resilience of our nation. #NeverForget
@MarquesColston @UofNO CONGRATS the students are very lucky!  Remember to grade on a curve.
Without question Trayford Pellerin should be alive right now. Read my statement on his fatal shooting that took place over the weekend: https://t.co/6KvFQS2Rcw

During these difficult times it is unthinkable for a large multinational corporation that has received untold billions of dollars in subsidies from the federal government to fail to keep their promises to their employees. https://t.co/1fNuoqWEfa

Don’t let the talk of tonight’s #verzuz distract you from watching this @BET special. Be sure to catch me along with some of my colleagues tonight on American Injustice: The Fight for Police Reform. #AmericanInjusticeBET https://t.co/K6D3cBpmaD
https://t.co/GegEKEdeon

We have truly reached the end of an era with the passing of my dear friend mentor Civil Rights legend and American icon @repjohnlewis. I’m grateful for his wisdom sacrifices and lifelong fight for justice. I thank him I love him and I will sorely miss him. https://t.co/718tpnkqOt
Congratulations @JoyAnnReid! Very well deserved. https://t.co/xA3S9gdiVu

May Officer Yvonne Bechet’s soul rest in paradise. We will always remember her lifelong service and sacrifice for the city of New Orleans. I send my strength and prayers to the family and friends of Yvonne Bechet. https://t.co/KcGaAZxIDi
Wishing you all a happy healthy and safe celebration of Independence Day today! Please remember to continue to exercise caution and wear masks should you convene in groups or large crowds.

Happy #CROWNDay! I’m proud to have authored the #CrownAct federal legislation in celebration of Black and Afro textured hair styles. It’s past time to end hair discrimination in our work places schools and housing in each and every state across the country. #FreeTheHair https://t.co/h9LW7Q4sIj
@CedricRichmond This sums it up perfectly. Amateur adolescent at 1600 Pennsylvania Ave https://t.co/LhAl22EPlF

America is crying for help just like George Floyd did. That is why the House will vote to pass the George Floyd #JusticeInPolicing Act today. We are past the point of enough being enough. We need comprehensive police reform now!
Sending heartfelt Father’s Day wishes to all fathers and father figures today! #FathersDay https://t.co/BGe36vuU3E
@JoyAnnReid Thank you Joy!
@AmandaSoprano https://t.co/sWgLo4LjFB https://t.co/L5NJbCNL9X
@RepJoeKennedy Thanks Joe!
@LSUCollegeDems When is he not angry?
@LaDemos Thank you!
@BrandonBG_ 🤷🏾‍♂️⚜️
Bye Steve! https://t.co/dnvSwLDlg3
On Memorial Day today we remember our service members who sacrificed their lives for our freedom. Let us also offer endless thanks to our courageous American heroes. #MemorialDay2020
@scottsantens I do honor and appreciate all mothers and mother figures. Instead of you attempting to speak for them on their day perhaps join me in honoring them too.
Wishing a Happy Mother’s Day to all mothers grandmothers Godmothers aunts and mother figures. We honor and appreciate you today and every day.

May is Mental Health Month and taking care of our mental health is important during these difficult times. Don’t be afraid to reach out for help if you or someone you know needs it. We can get through this together. Learn more at https://t.co/PFNb0ynOK3 #NotAlone #MHM

#COVID19 has made the health disparities that have long existed in America all the more apparent. That’s why I’m standing with @CAPAC @HispanicCaucus @OfficialCBC during #MinorityHealthMonth to take on the structural inequalities that contribute to these disparities. #NMHM2020

Important information for my constituents: @La_Appleseed recently issued their COVID-19 bulletin on free Civil Legal Aid services available to you and others in need throughout the state. Please contact their hotline for further details at 1-844-244-7871. https://t.co/amdswm3Wmm

I wish all those celebrating today a happy and healthy Easter. We may be in difficult times but better days are coming. On this Resurrection Sunday let us remember and practice principles of faith mercy and peace towards each other. Our resilience depends on it. #Easter2020
The @IRSnews recently launched an online portal for non-filers to enter direct deposit information to receive Economic Impact Payments here: https://t.co/niC1k9hHxk
I’m proud of @Allstate for putting money back into the pockets of their Louisiana customers and others nationwide. https://t.co/1cZof2jZ9h

Today I sent a letter to @SpeakerPelosi calling on Congress to create a Select Committee to investigate the disproportionate percentage of minority mortality from COVID-19. In Louisiana 70% of COVID-19 related deaths are from the Black community. We must act soon to save lives. https://t.co/Q8Bx4zIk60
I’d like to wish a happy and healthy Passover to all those celebrating! #Passover2020

It’s always the right time to do the right thing. That’s why my colleagues and I sent a letter to @SBAgov and @USTreasury expressing our opposition to recent changes to the Paycheck Protection Program. Read my statement here: https://t.co/bncCAww1Rp

New Orleans has truly lost a piece of our heart that we will never be able to fill. I mourn the loss of our beloved jazz icon Ellis Marsalis Jr. His music will forever fill our hearts with joy and our streets with melodies. May his soul rest in paradise. https://t.co/jyZuLenFwK

This #CensusDay I urge my constituents to participate. Now more than ever representation truly matters. By taking just a few short minutes you’ll be able to influence your community for years to come. Visit https://t.co/jFSYzq90jW to complete the form online. #2020Census
@nfib_la @smallbiz You’re welcome!

To Louisiana Small Business Owners please refer to this chart comparing the Paycheck Protection Program to the Economic Injury Disaster Loan. Reach out to my office for additional assistance or if you have any questions. https://t.co/f2In80x2Fo

Today the House passed the CARES Act in response to the Coronavirus pandemic. For my constituents in Louisiana’s Second Congressional district I have resources for you and am here for you. Please read and share my COVID-19 Critical Recovery Report: https://t.co/f52C3LmA1S

As we work through the uncertainty that the spread of coronavirus has brought us I’ll continue to advocate for adequate resources for all of my constituents. Please subscribe to my e-newsletter to receive up-to-date information as the situation develops: https://t.co/ZQY8SgrHzs
@lasaptrio You’re welcome!

While you continue to practice safe social distancing at home please use this link to follow guidelines for the Small Business Administration’s Economic Injury Disaster Loan process: https://t.co/xdT2rNnl6Q

The U.S. Small Business Disaster Loan Assistance application is now live. I urge my constituents in need to apply now. Visit the website at https://t.co/JqY62XE1ZN and view some useful frequently asked questions. https://t.co/kSz294hQca

Yesterday I held a tele-town hall for my constituents on COVID-19. While I was glad to address their questions it became clear to me how much our seniors depend on us during this challenging time. I’m calling on the federal government to expand the Meals on Wheels program.
@secftweets Thank you for stopping by today!

UPDATE: The Louisiana Department of Health has reported its first presumptive positive case of the Coronavirus this afternoon. Please continue to wash your hands thoroughly and stay home if you feel sick.

While Louisiana is still one of 16 states without a confirmed case of the Coronavirus it’s still in good form to wash your hands thoroughly for at least 20 seconds. Any one of these recommended Nola songs will help keep you upbeat in the process. https://t.co/nFlarDP6ys

Thank you to @TulaneLaw for featuring my work on the CROWN Act with fellow alum @ProfessorDWendy. We must continue to move forward on the fight against discrimination of Afro textured hair. https://t.co/zH5vienx2E #CROWNAct #BHM2020 #TulaneLaw

Thank you to all those who joined my Census jobs fair in Baton Rouge today. If you are in New Orleans tomorrow please be sure to join us to meet with @uscensusbureau recruiters and learn about 2020 Census jobs. We need to make sure everyone gets counted. #Census2020 https://t.co/T6FLibeh0N
May Katherine Johnson rest in power. We are all better for her contributions to NASA and her role as a trailblazing African-American woman in STEM. https://t.co/mjSlKuSuhE

Congratulations to @MatthewACherry @KarenRToliver and the entire Hair Love team on your Oscar win! Thank you for your work on representation and promoting the CROWN Act. I’m so proud to have authored legislation on a federal level to end discrimination against Black hair. https://t.co/NNYsMTcwS6
@Jordantmv Your impeached president gave 1.5 TRILLION away to the top 1%. With him we will be financially bankrupt and morally bankrupt!  Purpose over politics!
This is a damn shame and this President wants Billions to build a wall! We can to better.  https://t.co/2yLeWbIj8K

This #BlackHistoryMonth let us to honor the leaders and trailblazers who came before us by recommitting ourselves to the fight for equality and justice. I’m proud to walk in the footsteps of so many of them from Louisiana as well as from inside the halls of Congress. #BHM2020

I join the world in grief with the heartbreaking passing of NBA legend Kobe Bryant and his daughter Gianna. I send my condolences to his wife family and fans during this tragic time. This is a very sad reminder to keep your loved ones close because tomorrow is not promised.

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. lived his life in service to others through the practice of peace and social justice. Let not only today but everyday serve as a reminder to honor him by following the footsteps of one of our world’s foremost visionaries. #MLK2020 https://t.co/yLevl5lhad
